revised_title: Successful Removal of Two Enlarged Stones from a Young Man's Urethra
tldr: A young man had two large stones lodged in his urethra for six years. A surgeon named Joseph Warner successfully removed the stones and shared the case with the Royal Society. The stones were presented to the society for further inspection and study. The case highlights the importance of medical innovation and the role of the Royal Society in sharing and learning from unique medical cases.
